history.proof: qsimpl time: 1 use: congruentZ,divide,IdZ,multZ. qsimpl time: 1 use: congruentZ,divide,IdZ,multZ. qsimpl time: 1 use: congruentZ,addZ_opposite,divide,IdZ,multZ. qsimpl time: 1 use: I,congruentZ,addZ_opposite,divide,IdZ,multZ.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x : Z, divide Z IdZ multZ OZ x x

Premises:
divide : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
congruentZ = fun x y n : Z => divide Z IdZ multZ OZ n (addZ x (oppZ y)) : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
mult_OZ : forall x : Z, multZ x OZ = OZ
gcd_OZ_absZ : forall b : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ OZ b (absZ b)
inversibleZ : forall x : Z, inversible Z multZ IZ x -> x = IZ \/ x = oppZ IZ
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1
mult_IZ : forall x : Z, multZ x IZ = x
tech_multZ_negO : forall x : Z, multZ (neg 0) x = oppZ x
mult_mIZ : forall x : Z, multZ x (neg 0) = oppZ x
sgn_abs : forall x : Z, multZ x (sgnZ x) = absZ x
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
gcdZ_is_gcd : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d
mult_succZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (succZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) x
tech_le_pos_abs : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> absZ x = x
tech_integ_posZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (pos n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
tech_integ_negZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (neg n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
mult_oppZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (oppZ y) = oppZ (multZ x y)
le_opp_OZ : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = OZ
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
le_opp_OZ_l : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> leZ (oppZ x) OZ
mult_predZ_r : forall x y : Z, multZ x (predZ y) = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ x)
le_opp_OZ2 : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y
multZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (eq_ind (multZ IZ x) (fun z : Z => z = x) eq_refl (multZ x IZ) (multZ_commutativity IZ x)) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ multZ IZ
mult_oppZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (oppZ x) y = oppZ (multZ x y)
mult_succZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (succZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) y
mult_predZ_l : forall x y : Z, multZ (predZ x) y = addZ (multZ x y) (oppZ y)
sign_absZ : forall x : Z, leZ OZ (absZ x)
Z_ring = conj addZ_commutativity (conj Z_group (conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (_ : IdZ y) => I) (conj multZ_associativity mult_add_distributivity))) : is_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ oppZ
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
add_IZ_succZ : forall x : Z, addZ x IZ = succZ x
Z_unitary_commutative_ring = conj Z_ring (conj multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral) : is_unitary_commutative_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ
add_mIZ_predZ : forall x : Z, addZ x (neg 0) = predZ x
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
pred_succZ : forall x : Z, predZ (succZ x) = x
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
abs_eq_or_oppZ : forall x : Z, {absZ x = x} + {absZ x = oppZ x}
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
addZ_opposite = fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj I (conj I (conj match x as z return (addZ z (oppZ z) = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_pos_negZ n | neg n => tech_add_neg_posZ n end match x as z return (addZ (oppZ z) z = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_neg_posZ n | neg n => tech_add_pos_negZ n end)) : opposite Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ

```coq
intros x. unfold divide, multZ, IdZ, divide in congruentZ. specialize (congruentZ x x x). apply congruentZ. apply addZ_opposite. apply I.
Qed.```

original: intros x. unfold divide, multZ, IdZ, divide in congruentZ. specialize (congruentZ x x x). apply congruentZ. apply addZ_opposite. apply I.
